intro: This tool helps you combine multiple DNA raw data files from different testing companies (AncestryDNA, MyHeritage, 23andMe, FamilyTreeDNA, LivingDNA) into a single, comprehensive genetic profile. Here's how the algorithm works:

problem.title: What Problem Does This Solve?
problem.description: When you test with multiple DNA companies, each company may:

list.gaps: Have gaps in their data (no-calls, shown as "--")
list.conflicts: Occasionally produce conflicting results for the same SNP

problem.conclusion: This algorithm intelligently combines your files to give you the most complete picture of your DNA.

step1.title: Step 1: Load First File
step1.description: The algorithm reads all SNPs from your first file and indexes them by their RSID (the unique identifier like "rs3131972")

step2.title: Step 2: Process Additional Files
step2.description: For each SNP in your additional files, the algorithm checks if the RSID already exists. If it's new, it adds it. If it exists with a different genotype, it resolves the conflict using your chosen strategy. This process repeats for all uploaded files.

step3.title: Step 3: Sort by Genomic Position
step3.description: The final merged file is sorted by chromosome number (1, 2, 3... 22, X, Y, MT) and position, matching standard genome references

conflict_resolution.title: Conflict Resolution Strategies
conflict_resolution.description: When the same SNP has different genotypes across multiple files, you can choose:

fill_missing.title: "Fill Missing" (Recommended):
fill_missing.description: If one file has missing data ("--" or "00") and the other has a value, use the value. If both have values, use the preferred file. This maximizes coverage.

prefer_file.title: "Prefer File":
prefer_file.description: Always use the genotype from your preferred file, regardless of missing data. Simpler but may lose valid data.

understanding_data.title: Understanding Your DNA Data
understanding_data.chromosome: Chromosome: Location (1-22, X, Y, or MT for mitochondrial)
understanding_data.position: Position: Exact base pair location on that chromosome
understanding_data.genotype: Genotype: Your two alleles at that position (e.g., "AA", "GC", "TT"). You inherit one from each parent

list.matches: Maximize DNA matches: More SNPs tested means better matching accuracy with genetic relatives
list.gaps: Fill testing gaps: Companies test different SNPs; merging gives you broader coverage
list.accuracy: Compare testing accuracy: The log file shows where companies disagreed
list.tools: Use specialized tools: Some genetic genealogy tools require specific SNPs that only certain companies test

footer: The algorithm is designed to be conservative and transparent, giving you confidence that your merged DNA file accurately represents your genetic data while maximizing completeness.
